clinical_study.brief_title: Patient's Satisfaction of Bispectral Index-guided Monitored Anesthesia Care
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Randomized Controlled Trial on the Patient's Satisfaction of Bispectral Index-guided Monitored Anesthesia Care

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators will evaluate the effect of bispectral index-guided titration of sedation during ear surgery under monitored anesthesia care on participant's satisfaction with anesthesia, as well as side effects caused by the anesthetics.

study_design_info.masking_description: The person who surveys the patient's satisfaction in the post anesthesia care unit does not know which group the patient was assigned to.

primary_outcome.time_frame: within 30 minutes after the end of surgery (in the PACU)

arm_group.description: The patients in the control group will receive MAC titrated according to observer's assessment of anesthesia/sedation(OAA/S) score.
The patients in the control group will receive MAC titrated according to bispectral index(BIS).

intervention.intervention_name: Titration under the guidance of BIS
intervention.description: The infusion rate of dexmedetomidine is increased by 0.1mcg/kg/h if BIS is greater than 80; The infusion rate is decreased by 0.1mcg/kg/h if BIS is less than 60.

intervention.intervention_name: Titration under the guidance of OAA/S
intervention.description: The infusion rate of dexmedetomidine is increased by 0.1mcg/kg/h if OAA/S is greater than 3; The infusion rate is decreased by 0.1mcg/kg/h if OAA/S is less than 3.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients receiving ear surgery with ASA physical status 1 or 2
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age under 19 years
- Pregnancy
- Cognitive disorder affecting daily activity
- Patients who cannot participate in the survey
- Allergy to the medication
- History of sedative abuse
